DOC.brief_summary: In this study, the investigators aimed to overview patients with specific and non-specific complications who admitted to intensive care unit following endoscopic retrograde cholangiopancreatography and had fatal course in the facility
DOC.detailed_description: The investigators retrospectively reviewed patients who underwent elective or emergent endoscopic retrograde cholangiopancreatography at semi-prone position under pharyngeal anesthesia (lidocaine spray) with routine monitoring (including electrocardiography, non-invasive blood pressure, peripheral capillary oxygen saturation) and standard sedation protocol (midazolam 0.02 mgkg-1; fentanyl, 1 mgkg-1; propofol 1 mgkg-1) between 2011 and 2016 after approval of local ethics committee of Umraniye Training Hospital.
DOC.criteria: Patients who underwent elective or emergent ERCP at semiprone position with routine monitoring and standard sedation protocol Patients who discharged to ward after treatment and followup in ICU
